evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: A.  Declaring that Sections 1(b) and 3 of the March 27, 2025 Executive Order are unlawful and null and void.

extracted.value: Declaring that Sections 1(b) and 3 of the March 27, 2025 Executive Order are unlawful and null and void.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: B.  Declaring that the Defendant Ezell’s March 27, 2025 Guidance on Executive Order Exclusions from Federal Labor-Management Programs, is unlawful as applied to AFSA.

extracted.value: Declaring that the Defendant Ezell’s March 27, 2025 Guidance on Executive Order Exclusions from Federal Labor-Management Programs is unlawful as applied to AFSA.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: C.  Enjoining Defendant Rubio and all his agents and subordinates from implementing Sections 1(b) and 3 of the March 27, 2025 Executive Order.

extracted.value: Enjoining Defendant Rubio and all his agents and subordinates from implementing Sections 1(b) and 3 of the March 27, 2025 Executive Order.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: E.  Enjoining Defendants State, USAID, and Rubio from continuing to fail to recognize AFSA as the exclusive representative of the members of the Foreign Service and ordering their agents to restore AFSA’s collective bargaining agreements and honor the agreements’ provisions.

extracted.value: Enjoining Defendants State, USAID, and Rubio from continuing to fail to recognize AFSA as the exclusive representative of the members of the Foreign Service and ordering their agents to restore AFSA’s collective bargaining agreements and honor the agreements’ provisions.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: F.  Awarding Plaintiff reasonable attorney fees and costs incurred.

extracted.value: Awarding Plaintiff reasonable attorney fees and costs incurred.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: G.  Ordering such further relief as the Court may deem just and appropriate.

extracted.value: Ordering such further relief as the Court may deem just and appropriate.

evidence.source_document: Plaintiff American Foreign Service Association's Motion for a Preliminary Injunction
evidence.text: submits this motion for preliminary injunctive relief.

evidence.source_document: Plaintiff American Foreign Service Association's Motion for a Preliminary Injunction
evidence.text: AFSA respectfully requests this Court to enjoin the application and enforcement of Sections 1(b), 3 and 6 of Executive Order No. 14251 and OPM’s Guidance on implementing the Executive Order as set forth in the proposed Order.

extracted.value: injunctive relief to enjoin the application and enforcement of Sections 1(b), 3 and 6 of Executive Order No. 14251 and OPM Guidance

Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Ultra Vires (Violation of Foreign Service Labor-Management Relations Statute/ Separation of Powers)

evidence.source_document: Plaintiff American Foreign Service Association's Motion for a Preliminary Injunction
evidence.text: Defendant Donald J. Trump issued Executive Order No. 14251 on March 27, 2025 that deprives an overwhelming majority of Foreign Service employees of their rights to organize and bargain collectively.

evidence.source_document: Plaintiff American Foreign Service Association's Motion for a Preliminary Injunction
evidence.text: Defendant Charles Ezell, the acting Director of the Office of Personnel Management, issued a Guidance Memorandum to Heads and Acting Heads of Agencies advising them on how to implement the Executive Order by withdrawing recognition from the employees’ exclusive bargaining representatives, terminating existing collective bargaining agreements and taking other actions to undermine the employee’s representatives, like AFSA.

evidence.source_document: Plaintiff American Foreign Service Association's Motion for a Preliminary Injunction
evidence.text: AFSA respectfully requests this Court to enjoin the application and enforcement of Sections 1(b), 3 and 6 of Executive Order No. 14251 and OPM’s Guidance on implementing the Executive Order as set forth in the proposed Order.
